principle.name: Modularity & DRY
principle.directive: Always architecture code into small, specialized modules. Never repeat logic across components.
principle.standard: Use functional components in React and class-based services in Python/Node.js where appropriate.

principle.name: Security First
principle.directive: Sanitize all user inputs and enforce least-privilege for API keys and database connections.
principle.standard: Never hardcode secrets. Use environment variables defined in `.env.example` templates.

principle.name: Type Safety & Clarity
principle.directive: Strict typing is mandatory. Code must be self-documenting for both humans and AI agents.
principle.standard: Use TypeScript for web apps and PEP 484 type hints for Python. Every function must have a clear docstring.

principle.name: Performance & Lighthouse
principle.directive: Target 100/100 Lighthouse scores. Optimize for perceived performance and Core Web Vitals.
principle.standard: Minimize main-thread work. Use lazy-loading, image compression, and efficient data structures by default.

principle.name: Error Management
principle.directive: Implement robust, graceful failovers. An application must never crash without a user-friendly error state.
principle.standard: Use Try/Catch blocks in JS and Try/Except in Python. Log errors to a central location for auditing.

principle.name: AI-Readability
principle.directive: Code must be optimized for multi-agent collaboration. Maintain a consistent, predictable structure.
principle.standard: Follow the `STRUCTURE.xml` conventions strictly. Use clear, descriptive variable names that reflect intent.
